objects.name: Analytic 0463
objects.description: Process creates a raw/packet socket and attaches a (e)BPF filter (setsockopt SO_ATTACH_FILTER/ATTACH_BPF or bpf(BPF_PROG_LOAD)). Immediately after a matching inbound packet, the same process binds/connects outward to a remote host (reverse shell or beacon).

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: socket(AF_PACKET|AF_INET, SOCK_RAW, *), setsockopt(… SO_ATTACH_FILTER|SO_ATTACH_BPF …), bpf(cmd=BPF_PROG_LOAD), open/openat path="/dev/bpf*" (BSD/macOS-like) or setcap cap_net_raw.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:osquery
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: family=AF_PACKET or protocol raw; process name not in allowlist.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Rare inbound packet characteristics (ICMP/UDP/TCP to uncommon port) from src_ip followed ≤TimeWindow by outbound SF from same host to src_ip.

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Flag raw-socket activity outside privileged daemons (root-only by default).
If using packet content (Zeek), treat high-entropy single-packet triggers as suspicious.
System services allowed to open AF_PACKET (dhclient, keepalived, LLDP, monitoring agents).
